article.title: MC$^2$: Multi-wavelength and dynamical analysis of the merging galaxy cluster ZwCl 0008.8+5215: An older and less massive Bullet Cluster

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following observations is NOT included in the multi-wavelength view of ZwCl 0008 presented in Figure 1?
choices: Chandra X-ray data
WSRT radio data
Spitzer infrared data
Subaru red sequence luminosity

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3 displays a size-magnitude diagram. What purpose does this diagram serve in the analysis of ZwCl 0008?
choices: To identify the red sequence of cluster member galaxies
To distinguish between stars and galaxies based on their size and magnitude
To estimate the redshift of the cluster
To determine the projected separation between the two subclusters

multiple_choice_question.text: What information about ZwCl 0008 is primarily conveyed by the red sequence luminosity distribution presented in Figure 9?
choices: The bimodal nature of the cluster, suggesting a merger scenario.
The presence of strong shocks in the intracluster medium.
The distribution of dark matter within the cluster.
The location of active galactic nuclei (AGN) within the cluster.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 14 shows the best-fit models for the X-ray surface brightness profile of ZwCl 0008. What can be concluded from the comparison of the β-model and shock-jump model?
choices: The shock-jump model is strongly favored, providing clear evidence for a shock.
The β-model is favored, suggesting the absence of a shock.
The presence of a radio relic implies a shock, but more X-ray data are needed to confirm it.
Both models fit the data equally well, making it impossible to draw conclusions about the presence of a shock.

multiple_choice_question.text: Equation 1 calculates the expected projected shock propagation distance. What does the factor β represent in this equation?
choices: The angle between the merger axis and the plane of the sky.
The ratio of the shock propagation speed to the collision speed.
The mass ratio of the two subclusters.
The time since merger pericenter.
